Posts.Title: Scan Today @ 11:00 TonyaB HLB

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2013 02:06PM tlangston07 wrote: Hi, Everyone. My name is Terry and I am 56 years old. I am originally from Texas and have lived in IL for 7 years. I am an Insurance Agent but am now on disability. I was dx Jan 16, 2012 at 1:22pm..Yep the exact time my life changed as I knew it with mets to liver right off. I lost my husband of 20 years on 12-12-12 and he was my rock and my everyhing. I did not think I could do this without him but I am. I am just fighting 2 battles now. I had chemo and then right mx in June. I had 28 rounds of rads and was off chemo from June until November when scans showed lung mets. So now on more chemo. I have 1 daughter with 3 kids and 2 of those I have raised since they were 3 and 4. They are now 20 and 21. Her other son is 7. I also have a stepdaughter that we lost in March of 2010 and she left us with 1 grandaughter who is 8. My grandchildren are my life..they have stepped up and are helping me. I have wonderful friends who help when I need them. I try and cherish everyday. I plan on taking a trip to see my family and friends in Texas when this round of chemo is over. I am not done yet as my journey has just begun. I am so glad to have found this site and all of ya'll. I love learning more about everyone. Great Idea! Hugs! Terry
Posts.Title: Roll Call 2013 LilSchatzie reader123

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2013 02:18PM tlangston07 wrote: Penny..I hear the pain in your words and want you to know you are def in my Prayers..God can provide the strength and lov we need. I have to tell you my miracle.  I am doing Brain Rads now with mets to liver and lungs. My last scan showed some progression to liver and lungs after doing the red devil. Well the Brain Rads are worse than any chemo I have done. I had to go to the hospital yesterday for fluids and the ER DR was great. He did a CT Scan on my lungs to make sure of no clots. When he got the results back he said I know your Onc said you had progression in the liver and lungs but your lungs are clear and look great to me.  What a Miracle!! Please hang on to your Faith...Hugs and Prayers!! Terry
Posts.Title: "Help Me" redwolf8812 Iwillwinthisbattle

I love reading all of these post..Thank ya'll so much! Terry

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2013 09:06PM tlangston07 wrote: Renae..I agree with everyone else. You def do need to talk to someone and maybe get some meds. For me I have accepted this is my new reality.(Most of the time)  Do I like it..NO. I grieve for the life that I had but I am trying to make the best of the life that I have been given now. That chapter of my book is closed but I have so many good memories and am looking forward to the next chapter. Do not skip the chapters of your life and read the ending because you will miss so much. We all get scared and lonely wondering where this journey is taking us. One day at a time and sometimes a moment at a time.  We are all here for you. I agree with Jennifer on the toilets..lol! Hugs! Terry
